pwdExplan: Length 8~12, at least one upper case and one lower case letter, one number and one special character.
certify18: I certify that I am 18 years of age or older, and agree to the User Agreement and Privacy Policy.
kycL2Req: KYC level 2 is required to purchase the bond.
kycL2Do: Kindly complete your KYC Level 2 process to proceed with purchasing the bond.
WebSummary: The Digital National Bond is poised to contribute to the growth and prosperity of El Salvador and its people, providing a solid foundation for the future. Don't miss out on this historic opportunity to be a part of the digital revolution in bonds.
bond-index.digitalNationalBond: The First Digital National Bond in the World
bondIntro.title: EL SALVADOR DIGITAL NATIONAL BOND
bondIntro.subtitle: El Salvador is the world's first country to establish Bitcoin as legal tender through legislation, with the aim of using Bitcoin as legal currency to attract investment, promote economic development, facilitate capital flow, advance financial inclusion, and strengthen currency diversification, among other multiple purposes. The issuance of El Salvador's first-ever blockchain-based US dollar digital national bond (DNB) comes with interest rates as high as 8% (7.5% or 8% depending on the face value), as well as multiple benefits including immigration programs, DFT, physical commemorative coins, and more, positioning El Salvador as a global hub for crypto economics and Web3.
bondIntro.introText1: El Salvador's Digital National Bond DNB, a cutting-edge digital financial instrument issued by the esteemed Government of El Salvador. This groundbreaking bond combines the stability and credibility of traditional bonds with the efficiency and accessibility of digital technology, opening up new opportunities for local and international investors.
bondIntro.introText2: Invest with confidence as you join us on this journey towards financial empowerment. The Digital National Bond is poised to contribute to the growth and prosperity of El Salvador and its people, providing a solid foundation for the future. Don't miss out on this historic opportunity to be a part of the digital revolution in bonds. Secure your future, invest in progress, and join hands with the Government of El Salvador as we forge a path to financial excellence. Take the first step towards a digitalized financial future today!
VerifyIdentityToUseOurServices: Verify your identity to use our services
VerifyAddressToUseOurServices: Verify your address to use our services

feature.theFirst: The first digital national bond in the world, uniquely commemorative.
feature.investOptions: Innovative financial instruments, safe and reliable, easy to management with flexible and convenient investment options.
feature.theType: Two different types: regurlar digital bond DNB and Stoshi digital bond XDNB:
feature.dnbValue: Face Value is $100 US dollar, interest rate is 7.5% per annum.
feature.XDNBValue: Face Value is $15,000 US dollar, interest rate is 8% per annum, with gold coin & NFT options on maturity.
feature.immgrit: Invest $150,000 USD to get permenant residency and invest $375,000 USD to get citizenship.

payment.cryptoPaymentDescription: Make secure and fast transactions using cryptocurrencies. Enjoy the benefits of decentralized digital currency for your bond purchases.
payment.bankTransferDescription: Pay conveniently through bank transfer. Transfer funds directly from your bank account to secure your bond investment.
payment.inPersonPaymentDescription: Prefer a personal touch? Visit our office and make the payment in person. Our team will assist you with your bond purchase and any queries you may have.
logos.techSupportDescription: Here are the logos of our dedicated Tech Support Team. These talented individuals work tirelessly to provide you with top-notch technical assistance and ensure a smooth experience with our products and services.
contact.name: Name
contact.amount: How much bond do you want to buy?

index.bond-t1: DNB - The World's First Digital National Bond
index.bond-t2: El Salvador's Issuance of the First Digital National Bond and Multiple Equity Programs
index.purchase-method-detail: BTC, USDT, USDC, DUSD, USD Wire Transfer

index2.bond-title1-detail: Users holding government bonds receive annual bond interest payments from the Salvadoran government at a fixed annual rate of 7.5% (XDNB) and 8% (DNB).
index2.bond-title2-detail: El Salvador highly values external investors. Investors will have access to an exclusive immigration pathway, obtaining Salvadoran green cards or passports based on their investment amount.
index2.bond-title3-detail: DNB is issued in the form of DFT and serves as a digital commemorative item for the first digital bond issuance. Holders enjoy multiple rights.
index2.bond-title4-detail: Upon maturity of the bond, DNB investors can exchange them for 1-ounce pure gold commemorative coins issued by the Salvadoran government.
index2.exclusive-underwriter-detail: PAY.COOL Company (PAY.COOL DA de VC) is a technology company focused on blockchain and payment technology. Registered in El Salvador, with offices in the United States and Canada, PAY.COOL is the exclusive underwriter of Salvadoran Digital Bonds, providing comprehensive technical and issuance support for the issuance of Salvadoran Digital Bonds.

index3.t3: This national bond offering is open to citizens of all countries except for Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Russia, and Belarus.

faq.content2: You can purchase digital national bonds using cryptocurrency. We support BTC, USDT, USDC, and DUSD. After purchase, the national bonds will be delivered to your address on time.
faq.btcPrice2: BTC is calculated based on the lowest price in the last 24 hours.
faq.content3: You can purchase national bonds using US dollars, usually through bank transfers. If you require other methods, please contact us.
faq.content4: To purchase with other currencies, you must first convert them to US dollars. If you are unable to exchange for US dollars, please contact us.

about.aboutBondTitle: About El Salvador Government USD Digital Bonds DNB & XDNB
about.aboutBondIntroduction: DNB & XDNB are digital forms of USD bonds issued by the government of El Salvador, which repay both principal and interest according to the bond terms.
about.salvadorBitcoinLegal: El Salvador is the world's first country to establish Bitcoin as legal tender through legislation. The government aims to attract investments, promote economic development, facilitate capital flow, enhance financial inclusion, and diversify currency using Bitcoin as legal tender.
about.digitalEconomyPlan: Simultaneously, El Salvador has developed a digital economic development plan centered around Bitcoin. This plan includes the construction of Bitcoin cities, the promotion of Web3, metaverse, artificial intelligence, and other emerging industries, making El Salvador a key hub for the digital economy in Central America and globally.
about.digitalBondIntroduction: The issuance of the digital bond DNB is part of El Salvador's national digital economic plan. In recent years, El Salvador has undergone significant changes with social stability and rapid economic growth. Given El Salvador's objective conditions, the government has chosen the new direction of the global mainstream industry, the digital economy, to provide impetus for the long-term development of the Salvadoran economy. By issuing digital bonds denominated in USD, El Salvador aims to support the development of its digital economy and provide opportunities for investors to share in the benefits of El Salvador's digital economy.
about.digitalBondFeatures: USD Digital Bonds are bonds issued in digital form on the blockchain. They are issued in the form of digital certificates and have characteristics such as low cost, high security, and strong liquidity. They are a new type of bond for the digital economy era. DNB, El Salvador's USD Digital Bond, is the government's first digital bond issuance, making it the world's first digital bond, and therefore, it has unique commemorative significance.
about.bondParametersDescription: This bond issuance is based on blockchain smart contracts and is divided into two types: DNB and XDNB. The specific parameters are as follows:
about.investElSalvadorDigitalBonds: Invest in El Salvador digital bonds and enjoy various rights such as interest income, immigration green channel, DFT, and the exchange of pure gold commemorative coins based on different investment amounts:
about.dftExchangeForGoldCoin: Exchange 1 ounce of gold coin for each DFT
about.investmentByPAYCOOL: The issuance of this digital bond is conducted legally by PAY.COOL Company (PAY.COOL DA de VC) via the FAB blockchain and PAY.COOL underwriting and subsequent trading platform, supervised by the Salvadoran Digital Asset Management Department (ABB). It supports purchases with USD and cryptocurrencies (BTC, USDT, USDC, DUSD). Investors can make purchases by registering and logging in to this website or through the Pay.cool wallet. Please note that users must undergo KYC (know-your-customer) to successfully invest in the digital bond; investors who do not pass KYC will be refunded.
about.contactUsByEmail: If you have any questions, please contact us by email:
about.fixedRateBonds: This bond issuance includes fixed-rate bonds with interest rates corresponding to the two denominations: DNB: 8%, XDNB: 7.5%. The Salvadoran government pays interest in November each year. If you hold the bond for less than a year from the first interest payment date, you will receive interest based on the actual holding period. For example, if a user buys $150,000 worth of digital bonds in the first year, receiving 10 DNB, and holds them for 292 days, their interest for that year would be $150,000 * 8% * (292/365) = $9600.
about.greenCardSupport: This bond issuance receives support from Salvadoran immigration policies and opens up a green immigration channel for bond investors. Investors meeting the standard criteria will receive professional immigration advisory services throughout the process. The specific investment immigration schemes are as follows:
about.uniqueDFT: Every DNB is a unique DFT. Investors holding DNB can permanently keep it as a commemorative item and participate in market trading after the bond matures. In addition, the Salvadoran government will continue to develop the Bitcoin City and web3 ecosystem, granting more rights to this DFT over time.
about.exchangeFor1OunceGoldCoin: DNB holders can exchange them for 1-ounce pure gold commemorative coins issued by the Salvadoran government after the bond matures.
about.investDetail: The issuance of this digital national bond is conducted by PAY.COOL DA de VC through the FAB blockchain and the PAY.COOL underwriting and subsequent trading platform in accordance with the law, and it is supervised by the Salvadoran Digital Asset Management Department (ABB). It supports the purchase with both US dollars and cryptocurrencies (BTC, USDT, USDC, DUSD). Investors can make purchases on this website after registering and logging in, or through the Pay.cool wallet. It's important to note that users need to go through the KYC (know-your-customer) process to successfully invest in the digital national bond, and investors who do not pass KYC will be refunded.
about.convertDnbToXdnb: Converting DNB to XDNB requires a 10% conversion fee
about.supportedCryptocurrencies: Supported cryptocurrencies: BTC, USDT, USDC, DUSD
about.investmentBenefits: Depending on the investment amount, investors can enjoy a green channel for immigration and green card acquisition. For details, please refer to the Equity Explanation - Immigration Policy
about.family: Family refers to spouses and children under 18

abount-el.about_detail: The Republic of El Salvador, La República de El Salvador, is a country located in the northern part of Central America, with a total area of 21,393 square kilometers. It shares borders with Guatemala to the northwest, Honduras to the northeast, and the Pacific Ocean to the west. To the southeast, it is adjacent to the Gulf of Fonseca. The capital is San Salvador.
abount-el.national_information_description: The Republic of El Salvador, La República de El Salvador.
abount-el.population: Population: 6.7 million (2019). Mestizos make up 86%, European descendants 13%, Indigenous people 1%.
abount-el.language: Language: Spanish is the official language.
abount-el.religion: Religion: Over 75% of the population follows Catholicism.
abount-el.currency: Currency: Colón (Colón), U.S. Dollar (main circulating currency, 1 USD equals 8.75 Colón), Bitcoin (legally recognized as of June 2021, exchange rate with USD determined by the market).
abount-el.capital: Capital: San Salvador City, covering an area of 72.25 square kilometers, with a population of 526,000 (2020).
abount-el.president: Head of State: President Nayib Bukele, took office on June 1, 2019, serving a 5-year term.
abount-el.important_dates: Important Holidays: Independence Day on September 15th, Peace Day on January 16th.
abount-el.web3_introduction: El Salvador is actively positioning itself as a global hub for Bitcoin and the Web3 ecosystem. By adopting Bitcoin as legal tender and fostering innovation and technology, El Salvador is rapidly rising as a leader in the digital age.
abount-el.bitcoin_legal_status: Legal Status of Bitcoin: In 2021, El Salvador became the first country in the world to officially recognize Bitcoin as legal tender. This significant move demonstrates the government's strong interest in digital currency and blockchain technology. The adoption of Bitcoin presents vast opportunities for both domestic and international investors and enhances access to financial services for the local population.
abount-el.positive_regulatory_environment: Positive Regulatory Environment: The Salvadoran government is committed to creating a favorable regulatory environment to attract blockchain and cryptocurrency businesses. Under these efforts, a series of regulations are being developed to ensure that investors and entrepreneurs can operate within a legal framework. This not only helps attract international investments but also supports local innovation.
abount-el.promoter_of_web3_ecosystem: Promoter of the Web3 Ecosystem: In addition to Bitcoin, El Salvador is dedicated to developing the Web3 ecosystem. This includes supporting innovation in blockchain technology, building smart contract platforms, and fostering blockchain engineers and developers. These initiatives aim to support emerging technologies and drive digital economic growth.
abount-el.international_cooperation: International Cooperation: El Salvador's vision for the digital age extends beyond its borders, seeking to accelerate global development in the Web3 field. The government actively seeks cooperation with international companies, investors, and innovators to jointly promote the development of the digital economy and Web3 technology for mutual benefit.
abount-el.location: El Salvador is located in northern Central America, bordering Guatemala and Honduras, and facing the Pacific Ocean.
abount-el.natural_features: The country boasts a stunning coastline, active volcanoes, lakes, and mountain ranges, attracting tourists and adventurers alike.
abount-el.coastline: The coastline stretches approximately 300 kilometers and is a popular destination for surf enthusiasts worldwide.
abount-el.volcanoes: El Salvador has more than 20 volcanoes, some of which are still active, providing spectacular volcanic landscapes and opportunities for climbing.
abount-el.coatepeque_lake: Lake Coatepeque is a renowned lake surrounded by magnificent mountains.
abount-el.nature_protection_areas: The country also features multiple nature protection areas dedicated to preserving unique ecosystems and wildlife.
abount-el.rich_cultural_environment: El Salvador takes pride in its rich cultural environment, boasting a deep history, diverse cultural traditions, and warm-hearted people.
abount-el.historical_heritage: The history dates back to the ancient Mayan civilization and retains a rich Spanish culture and traditions.
abount-el.cultural_traditions: Cultural traditions blend indigenous, Spanish, African, and other elements, reflected in music, dance, cuisine, and handicrafts.
abount-el.artists_and_writers: El Salvador has nurtured many outstanding artists and writers, such as the poet Rolando Flores and painter Francisco Torres.
abount-el.religion_in_culture: Religion plays a significant role in local society and culture, with various religious celebrations and activities attracting visitors.
abount-el.hospitable_people: The people of El Salvador are known for their hospitality and friendliness, offering visitors a genuine welcome.
abount-el.economic_environment: Economic Environment: In recent years, El Salvador has achieved social stability and steady economic growth. In 2021, the per capita GDP was approximately $9,400 USD (purchasing power parity). The poverty rate has decreased by 20% over the past decade.
abount-el.crime_issues: Crime Issues: El Salvador has faced high crime rates in the past, particularly related to violence and criminal gangs. Since President Bukele took office in 2019, a series of measures have been implemented, including strengthening law enforcement, combating criminal gangs, and improving social and economic conditions. Today, El Salvador enjoys its safest period in 30 years, with all crime rates reaching new lows.
abount-el.immigration_and_remittances: Immigration and Remittances: Many Salvadorans choose to migrate to other countries, such as the United States, in search of better opportunities. Remittances, especially from Salvadoran diaspora in the United States, are a crucial pillar of El Salvador's economy. Since 2001, the official currency in El Salvador has been the U.S. Dollar. In 2021, El Salvador became the world's first country to recognize Bitcoin as legal tender. A stable and innovative currency system is the cornerstone of El Salvador's economic development.
abount-el.passport_ranking: El Salvadoran passports rank 38th on the 'Guide Passport Ranking Index.' Salvadorans holding passports can enter 99 countries and territories without a visa and obtain visas on arrival in 32 countries and territories. Holding a Salvadoran passport offers convenient travel access to important countries and regions across all continents, from the Northern Lights in Scandinavia to the Louvre in France, the tulip fields and windmills of the Netherlands, and the romantic landscapes of Turkey.

userAgreement.welcomeMessage: Welcome to the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website (hereinafter referred to as 'we' or 'the website'). Please read and understand this User Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the 'Agreement') carefully before using this website. By accessing or using this website, you agree to comply with the following terms and conditions. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use this website.

sectionDefinitions.title: 1. Definitions and Interpretation
sectionDefinitions.website: 1.1. Website: Refers to the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website.
sectionDefinitions.user: 1.2. User: Refers to individuals or entities accessing and using this website.
sectionDefinitions.bonds: 1.3. Bonds: Refers to national bonds issued by the Salvadoran government.
sectionDefinitions.kyc: 1.4. KYC: Know Your Customer, including identity verification and compliance requirements, aimed at ensuring the transparency and legality of financial transactions.

sectionUseLicense.title: 2. Use License
sectionUseLicense.authorization: 2.1. Authorization to Use: This website grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and use this website for bond transactions and financial services. You agree not to violate any applicable laws and regulations or misuse or disrupt the normal operation of the website while using it.
sectionUseLicense.ageRequirement: 2.2. Age Requirement: You must be of legal age to use this website, or use it under the supervision of a legal guardian.
sectionUseLicense.illegalAccess: 2.3. Unauthorized Access: You are not allowed to engage in illegal or unauthorized access or use, money laundering, terrorist financing, or any other unlawful activities.

sectionRegistrationAndAccount.title: 3. Registration and Account
sectionRegistrationAndAccount.accountCreation: 3.1. Account Creation: Some features or services may require you to register and create a personal account. During registration, you must provide accurate and complete information, including your real name, identification details, contact information, and more.
sectionRegistrationAndAccount.accountSecurity: 3.2. Account Security: You are fully responsible for your account and password, and you must not disclose them to others. You are responsible for all activities in your account.

sectionKYC.title: 4. KYC (Know Your Customer)
sectionKYC.kycInfo: 4.1. KYC Information: To comply with applicable laws and regulations, we need to collect and verify your KYC information, such as identity documents, address verification, tax documents, and other relevant certificates. This helps ensure compliance in bond transactions.

sectionFinancialTransactions.title: 5. Financial Transactions
sectionFinancialTransactions.financialTransactions: 5.1. Financial Transactions: When using this website for financial transactions, you should follow the guidelines and procedures provided on the website. Financial transactions may include purchasing bonds and other related financial activities.
sectionFinancialTransactions.transactionLimitations: 5.2. Transaction Limitations: You understand and agree that your financial transactions may be subject to limitations and regulations imposed by applicable laws and regulations, including domestic and international compliance requirements.

sectionPurchaseBonds.title: 6. Purchase of Bonds
sectionPurchaseBonds.purchaseBonds: 6.1. Purchase of Bonds: The purchase of bonds is one of the core services of this website. When purchasing bonds, you must adhere to the following conditions:
sectionPurchaseBonds.kycVerification: 6.2. KYC Verification: When purchasing bonds, you must ensure that you provide accurate personal information for KYC verification to comply with applicable laws and regulations.
sectionPurchaseBonds.paymentMethods: 6.3. Payment Methods: You can choose to purchase bonds using digital currency or bank transfers. Please note that payment methods may be subject to applicable legal regulations. We support various payment methods but require compliance with anti-money laundering regulations.
sectionPurchaseBonds.transactionConfirmation: 6.4. Transaction Confirmation: All transactions for bond purchases will receive confirmation notices to ensure you understand transaction details, including transaction quantity, price, and confirmation date.
sectionPurchaseBonds.bondsDelivery: 6.5. Bonds Delivery: Purchased bonds will ultimately be delivered to your designated Pay.cool wallet, and you must ensure the accuracy of your Pay.cool account information.

sectionPrivacyPolicy.title: 7. Privacy Policy
sectionPrivacyPolicy.privacyProtection: 7.1. Privacy Protection: You agree to comply with the website's Privacy Policy, which details how we keep your personal information confidential, including KYC information and transaction data.

sectionDataSecurity.title: 8. Data Security
sectionDataSecurity.accountSecurity: 8.1. Account Security: You agree to take reasonable security measures to protect your account and personal information. We are not responsible for unauthorized access. You should also understand the risks and take security measures to protect your digital currency wallet and personal information.

sectionLegalCompliance.title: 9. Legal Compliance
sectionLegalCompliance.complianceRequirements: 9.1. Compliance Requirements: You agree to comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to financial regulatory requirements, anti-money laundering, and counter-terrorist financing regulations. We actively cooperate with law enforcement agencies and enforce legal requirements.

sectionChangesAndTermination.title: 10. Changes and Termination
sectionChangesAndTermination.rightsReserved: 10.1. Rights Reserved: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or terminate this website at any time, including terminating your access and usage. We will provide advance notice whenever possible.

sectionDisclaimer.title: 11. Disclaimer
sectionDisclaimer.disclaimer: 11.1. Disclaimer: The information provided on this website and bond transactions are for reference only and come with no express or implied guarantees. Financial markets involve volatility, and you should assume investment risks on your own.

sectionDisputeResolution.title: 12. Dispute Resolution
sectionDisputeResolution.legalJurisdiction: 12.1. Legal Jurisdiction: This Agreement is governed by Salvadoran laws and shall be resolved in [relevant court]. Both parties agree to resolve any disputes through mediation or court proceedings.

sectionContactUs.title: 13. Contact Us
sectionContactUs.contactUs: 13.1. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Agreement or the website, please contact us.

userAgreement.thankYouMessage: Thank you for reading and understanding this User Agreement. We hope you have a smooth experience purchasing bonds on the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.welcomeMessage: Welcome to the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website (hereinafter referred to as 'we' or 'the website'). We highly value the protection of your privacy and personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and protect your personal information, particularly information related to KYC, cryptocurrency payments, and Pay.cool wallet. Please read and understand this policy carefully.

sectionCollectInformation.title: 1. Collected Information
sectionCollectInformation.personalIdentity: 1.1. Personal Identity Information: Such as name, identification documents, contact information (email address, phone number), date of birth, etc. These details are used for KYC verification and transaction processing.
sectionCollectInformation.financialInformation: 1.2. Financial Information: Including bank accounts, credit card information, etc., for the purpose of executing transactions like purchasing Salvadoran Government Bonds. This information is used solely for transaction purposes.
sectionCollectInformation.kycInformation: 1.3. KYC Information: To ensure compliance with laws and regulations, we may need to collect and verify your KYC information, such as copies of identification documents, address verification, and other relevant documents.
sectionCollectInformation.cryptoPaymentInformation: 1.4. Cryptocurrency Payment Information: If you choose to use cryptocurrency for payments, we may collect information related to this payment method, such as cryptocurrency wallet addresses.
sectionCollectInformation.payCoolWalletInformation: 1.5. Pay.cool Wallet Information: If Salvadoran Government Bonds are to be delivered to your Pay.cool wallet, we may require you to provide relevant Pay.cool wallet information, such as Pay.cool account addresses.

sectionUseInformation.title: 2. Use of Information
sectionUseInformation.kycVerification: 2.1. KYC Verification: Collecting and verifying KYC information to ensure compliance with laws and regulatory requirements.
sectionUseInformation.transactionProcessing: 2.2. Transaction Processing: Handling your financial transactions, including the purchase of Salvadoran Government Bonds, and ensuring payment and transaction confirmations.
sectionUseInformation.customerSupport: 2.3. Customer Support: Providing you with support and responses regarding purchases, transactions, or accounts.
sectionUseInformation.legalCompliance: 2.4. Legal Compliance: Adhering to legal and regulatory requirements, including financial regulations and tax laws.
sectionUseInformation.websiteImprovement: 2.5. Website Improvement: Improving the website and user experience based on user feedback and needs.

sectionInformationDisclosure.title: 3. Information Disclosure
sectionInformationDisclosure.kycCompliance: 3.1. KYC Compliance: We may share your KYC information with compliance agencies to ensure regulatory compliance.
sectionInformationDisclosure.legalRequirements: 3.2. Legal Requirements: We may be required to disclose your personal information based on applicable laws and regulations, court orders, or government agency requests.
sectionInformationDisclosure.cryptoPaymentProviders: 3.3. Cryptocurrency Payment Providers: If you choose cryptocurrency payments, we may share necessary information with cryptocurrency payment providers for processing payments.
sectionInformationDisclosure.payCoolWallet: 3.4. Pay.cool Wallet: If Salvadoran Government Bonds are to be delivered to your Pay.cool wallet, we may need to share relevant information to complete this process.

sectionDataSecurity.title: 4. Data Security
sectionDataSecurity.securityMeasures: We implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. We regularly assess and improve our security measures to ensure data protection.

sectionMinorPrivacy.title: 5. Minor's Privacy
sectionMinorPrivacy.minorUsage: Our website is not intended for minors. If you are a minor, you can only use this website under the supervision of a legal guardian.

sectionPrivacyUpdates.title: 6. Privacy Updates
sectionPrivacyUpdates.accessCorrection: You have the right to access, correct, update, or delete your personal information at any time. If you wish to exercise these rights or have any questions about the Privacy Policy, please contact us.

sectionPrivacyPolicyUpdates.title: 7. Privacy Policy Updates
sectionPrivacyPolicyUpdates.policyModification: We reserve the right to modify or update this Privacy Policy as needed. Any changes will be posted on this page and will be effective. Please regularly check our Privacy Policy to stay informed about information updates.

sectionInformationRegulation.title: 8. Information Regulation
sectionInformationRegulation.governmentRegulation: This website, as the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website, is authorized by the Salvadoran government and is subject to regulation by the Salvadoran government.

sectionContactUs.title: 9. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us:

privacyPolicy.thankYouMessage: Thank you for choosing the Salvadoran Government Bonds Sales Website. We value your privacy and data protection.

did.digital_citizen_plan_description: The Digital Citizen Plan is an emerging digital identity system recognized by national sovereignty, designed to enable individuals and businesses to produce and provide services online globally through encryption technology. Originating from the 1.0 version pioneered by countries such as Estonia, El Salvador's 2.0 version integrates elements like DID, NFT, and DAO, creating a more comprehensive economic system that is crypto-asset-friendly and metaverse-oriented. This represents an innovative development in the digital economy and opens new opportunities for global citizens and businesses to transcend physical boundaries.
did.what_is_digital_citizen_plan: What is the Digital Citizen Plan?
did.digital_citizen_plan_necessity: The Digital Citizen Plan has emerged as a necessity in modern times, enabling production and business operations to be carried out online, surpassing physical, racial, and national boundaries. The plan provides a state-recognized digital identity, facilitating the establishment and operation of global companies through encryption technology.
did.el_salvador_digital_citizen_plan_2: Following the legalization of Bitcoin as legal tender, El Salvador has introduced the Digital Citizen Plan 2.0, which incorporates elements such as DID, NFT, and DAO into its framework, to redefine the digital economy in the crypto world.
did.strategic_blueprint: Strategic Blueprint for El Salvador's Digital Citizen Plan 2.0:
did.digital_citizen_plan_2_description: The Digital Citizen 2.0 plan includes the creation of a national-level open blockchain public service platform, establishing a "META Country· El Salvador" within the metaverse, and promoting the digitization of physical assets through NFTs.
did.implementation_and_goals: Implementation and Goals of the Digital Citizen Plan 2.0:
did.digital_citizen_plan_goals: The plan aims to create a comprehensive ecosystem that supports digital citizenship, including blockchain infrastructure, decentralized governance, and an economic system that is friendly to crypto assets.
did.el_salvador_vision: El Salvador envisions becoming a leading digital nation in the metaverse, emphasizing the potential for economic growth, innovation, and attracting global talent.
